Title.evidence: We conducted a prospective randomized trial

Participants.evidence: a tertiary healthcare center in the United States

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomized to 4 arms based on the following pre/intraoperative warming combinations: (1) CW/CW, (2) FAW/FAW, (3) no active prewarming (NAPW)/CW, (4) NAPW/FAW.

Objective.evidence: We examined the association of four combinations of pre- and intraoperative CW and FAW with the magnitude of intraoperative hypothermia.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The area under the temperature curve (AUC) below 36°C was calculated according to the trapezoidal rule and quantified intraoperative hypothermia.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The ratio of mean AUC [95% CI] between CW/CW vs NAPW/FAW was 0.49 [0.24, 0.98], 51% lower, and between NAPW/CW and NAPW/FAW, 0.46 [0.23, 0.91], 54% lower.
